page.title: 21Leaden Roding Fire Stn in 2011
page.content:
Leaden Roding Fire Station is currently manned by 10 Retained Firefighters,each having regular jobs and attending the fire station for training,essential maintenance work, community fire safety initiatives and in response to the receipt of an emergency call. Retained firefighters commit to being available for callouts for 80-120 hours per week and can be sent to incidents anywhere in Essex. They are called out by ECFRS Control at Hutton,using a radio transmitter to set off pocket alerters carried by the firefighters. The details of the incident are printed on the turnout printer at the station. Leaden Roding attends 100 to 150 calls a year including fires, road accidents, animal rescues, industrial accidents and more.

The current fire engine is a 2004 Scania P90D fitted out as a Rescue Pump with a 13.5m ladder, hydraulic cutting equipment and 4 sets of breathing apparatus in addition to firefighting equipment.
Anon
